Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters

Class BaseRepeater

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Application, BaseCollectionChangeWatcher, BaseConverter, BaseExtractor, BaseReadableResource, BaseServiceRegistry, BaseWriter, Batcher, BinaryObjectStore, ConfigurationSet, ConnectionListener, CsvSchema, DeploymentSet, EmailSender, FieldArchive, HdfsProxyClient, JarLauncher, JettyServer, KivaKitThread, KryoSerializationSession, MessageChecker, Project, Retry, ServiceRegistryClient, ServiceRegistryStore, StateMachine, VirtualReferenceTracker
    public class BaseRepeater
extends Multicaster
implements Repeater
    A multicasting repeater which repeats all the messages it receives to a set of listeners. A base repeater is a convenient way of implementing the Repeater interface by extension.

    However, if a class is already extending some other base class (and since Java does not support mix-ins), an instance of BaseRepeater can be aggregated and its methods delegated to implement the Repeater interface with minimal effort: 

     public class A extends B implements Repeater<Message>
 {
     private final BaseRepeater<Message> repeater = new BaseRepeater<>();

     public void broadcast(final Message message)
     {
         this.repeater.broadcast(message);
     }

     public void broadcastTo(final Listener<Message> listener)
     {
         this.repeater.broadcastTo(listener);
     }

     public void clearListeners()
     {
         this.repeater.clearListeners();
     }

     public boolean hasListeners()
     {
         return this.repeater.hasListeners();
     }
 }
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
